intro: Stephanopodium blanchetianum, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to withstand harsh weather. Stephanopodium blanchetianum is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
